data.text: Waterproof Pants for Bikepacking in Scotland?

Hello everybody! I'm going to bikepack in Scotland in may and I'm preparing the backpack, I'm sure you can give good advice! I don't know the weather, but I fear some rain for sure. I have doubts of bringing waterproof pants or using trekking pants instead in case of heavy rain. What would you suggest? Thanks!

I would honestly abandon waterproofs and instead wear something like leggings that dry quickly. Have a dry set wrapped in plastic bags at all times. You can drink from most of the rivers, carry chocolate at all times, and jungle formula for the midges and you'll find the north west coast roads in particular are MAGNIFICENT, even in bad weather. Good luck and welcome!

data.text:
I live in Scotland, albeit the North East in Aberdeenshire. To keep the midges at bay I usually use Smidge and find it more effective than Skin so soft. Last year there were quite a few dry days and even here the sun can be powerful so I'd cater for that as much as for the rain. I am cycling most days in shimano thermal water resistant leggings at the moment which do the job really well and have just worn those through the winter and not needed waterproof trousers, but I usually cycle no more than 40 miles (e bike). May is early-ish for the midgies, thinking about it, you can get a report on their website https://www.smidgeup.com/. I'd avoid drinking from rivers unless you're really remote.
